Nosferatu

The Nosferatu and their antitribu use the oip disciplines. Some good vampires of theirs are used in multi-clan crypts, like {{ link("/archetypes/nananimalism", _("Nananimalism")) }} or {{ link("/archetypes/the-dark-side-of-politics", _("The Dark Side of Politics")) }}. They are seen on their own in only one prominent archetype: the {{ link("/archetypes/nosferatu-royalty", _("Nosferatu Royalty")) }}, a toolbox using Camarilla Princes and Justicars.

Highlights

Stick

played in 84 decks, typically 1-2 copies

The cheapest I pool can buy, he gets included in many i decks.

Beetleman

played in 75 decks, typically 1 copy

A cheap I minion, he also gets included in many i decks.

Petra

played in 41 decks, typically 1 copy

5 pool is a bit pricey for I so she is less seen in mono I or multi-clan decks. Her ability can be useful against {{ card("The unnamed") }} or {{ card("Cybele") }} though.

The Labyrinth

played in 38 decks, typically 1 copy

One pool for permanent stealth is really a bargain: other clans have to pay 2 pool for this kind of device. Only the Followers of Set have a similar tool with {{ card("Opium Den") }}.

Warsaw Station

played in 31 decks, typically 1-2 copies

A rare effect, quite useful in Nosferatu decks using political actions, like the {{ link("/archetypes/nosferatu-royalty", _("Nosferatu Royalty")) }} archetype.

Nikolaus Vermeulen

played in 27 decks, typically 1-2 copies

The iconic vampire for {{ link("/archetypes/nosferatu-royalty", _("Nosferatu Royalty")) }} decks, he has an excellent ability that helps get other Princes out faster and cheaper, or bloat a bit.

Gustaphe Brunnelle

played in 25 decks, typically 1-2 copies

Appreciated for his rush ability, he is often included in combat-oriented PI decks like the {{ link("/archetypes/guruhi-rush", _("Guruhi Rush")) }} archetype.

Calebros, The Martyr

played in 25 decks, typically 1-2 copies

A Prince available for a really cheap price, even though his ability can be a problem depending on the context.

Murat

played in 23 decks, typically 1-2 copies

A Prince for the very reasonable price of 7 pool, he is often seen in {{ link("/archetypes/nosferatu-royalty", _("Nosferatu Royalty")) }} decks alongside {{ card("Nikolaus Vermeulen") }} and {{ card("Calebros, The Martyr") }}.

Alonso Petrodon

played in 22 decks, typically 2-4 copies

His title and bleed bonus, combined with the rare DO discipline combination, makes him a good pick in some political decks, like in the {{ link("/archetypes/mistress", _("Mistress")) }} archetype. His ability can destroy low capacity Anarch decks single-handedly.

Selma the Repugnant

played in 17 decks, typically 1-3 copies

Yet another Prince, she is a bit expensive and does not even have superior I. Still, she can find her place in Royalty constructs using O, like in {{ link("/archetypes/the-dark-side-of-politics", _("The Dark Side of Politics")) }} archetype.

Beast, The Leatherface of Detroit

played in 15 decks, typically 1-3 copies

Always included for his ability and strength combined with Pc, he gets included in P decks like for example in the {{ link("/archetypes/euro-brujah", _("Euro Brujah")) }} archetype. He is often seen alongside {{ card("Theo Bell") }}, as they share similar abilities.
